summary: This document is an email chain from August 2020 within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY), forwarding three voicemail recordings from an unnamed individual in Australia. The caller claims to be a prisoner, references crimes against her, and mentions Jeffrey Epstein, Lisa Marie Presley, the British Royal Family, and President Trump. The office is passing the information for review but notes they will block the number and take no further action due to the international nature of the call.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced by an anonymous caller from Australia who is discussing crimes and mentions his name among other high-profile figures.

persons.name: Lisa Marie Presley
persons.context: Referenced by an anonymous caller from Australia in the context of discussing crimes.

persons.name: President Trump
persons.context: Referenced by an anonymous caller from Australia in the context of discussing crimes.

events.title: Voicemails Received from Australian Caller
events.description: Three voicemails were received by the U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) from an unnamed individual in Australia claiming to be a prisoner and discussing crimes committed against her, while referencing Jeffrey Epstein and other high-profile figures.

locations: United States Attorney's Office, SDNY (Southern District of New York)
keyFacts: In August 2020, the U.S. Attorney's Office for the SDNY received three voicemails from an anonymous individual in Australia.
The caller claimed to be a prisoner and alleged crimes were committed against her.
The caller referenced Jeffrey Epstein, Lisa Marie Presley, the British Royal Family, and President Trump.
The U.S. Attorney's Office decided to block the caller's number and take no further action due to the international nature of the call and principles of international comity.
The document shows the office's protocol for handling unsolicited, international tips or claims related to high-profile cases like Epstein's.
